intro: Mesembryanthemum ausense, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and flowers. The plant produces small, orange-red fruits that resemble small tomatoes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
